4.29.21  7:36 pm   I have a piano keyboard and started experimenting with it like I saw you suggest here in the questions a few times to others. I barely know any music theory but the stuff I improvised actually sounded pretty good. However that was just more or less randomly pressing chords and making a melody w/o knowing where it is going or what it would sound like.

     When I try to actually write a song on purpose it is no good. Is this normal?

      Please advise me

4.28.21  11:05 pm   I've been making songs recently, just because I can.  But I've noticed something weird about it.  While I'm in the middle of making a song, the catchy melody is all I can think about, all day, and it's like I can't rest until I keep making the song.  This happens every day until I finally finish the song.  Do you experience this as well,

      and do you have any words of wisdom to combat these feelings?
